title: Judge Rules Trump Administration Illegally Canceled Harvard Funding
summary: The ruling was a victory for the university in its battle with President Trump, but the judge’s decision may not be the final word.

title: Trump Administration Says Boat Strike Is Start of Campaign Against Venezuelan Cartels
summary: The defense secretary and President Trump said a small boat was carrying drugs but offered little evidence and few details.

title: Venezuela, Drug Boats and Trump’s Latest Claim: What to Know
summary: The Trump administration says Venezuela is sending vast amounts of cocaine to the United States. Venezuela’s role in the drug trade is overstated, experts say.

title: U.S. and Mexico Vow to Cooperate Against Crime as Rubio Meets Sheinbaum
summary: Secretary of State Marco Rubio met with President Claudia Sheinbaum, after she pressed the Trump administration not to take unilateral action in Mexico.

title: At Least 15 Dead After Lisbon Funicular Derails and Crashes, Officials Say
summary: The funicular line, one of three in Lisbon, is a popular tourist attraction.

title: Snubbing RFK Jr., States Announce Plans to Coordinate on Vaccines
summary: California, Oregon and Washington said they would work together to review scientific data, saying the C.D.C. could no longer be trusted. But Florida said it would abolish all vaccine mandates.

title: Florida Moves to End Vaccine Mandates for Schoolchildren
summary: The state would be the first to scrap requirements that children be vaccinated to attend school, among other rules.

title: F.D.A. Official Overruled Scientists on Wide Access to Covid Shots
summary: The agency’s staff scientists pointed out how Covid was still unpredictable and posed a threat to toddlers, but the official decided to restrict shots only to children with risk factors.

title: 100 Dinner Ideas for Right Now
summary: Fall is busy enough. Let us help with the cooking.

title: Senator’s Visit to Spy Agency Was Canceled After Laura Loomer Complained
summary: Senator Mark Warner’s visit was classified and not intended to be publicized. It was to include a meeting with the head of the agency and a briefing on the agency’s use of artificial intelligence.

title: G.O.P. Thwarts Epstein Disclosure Bill as Accusers Plead for Files
summary: Jeffrey Epstein’s accusers went to the Capitol to ask Congress to get behind their calls for more disclosures, but momentum for a bill demanding it appeared to stall.

title: Smithsonian Responds to Trump’s Demand for a Review of Its Exhibits
summary: In a letter to the White House, the Smithsonian asserted its “authority over our programming and content,” but said a team would review what information it would turn over.

title: Trump Grows Frustrated With Putin, as Russian President Bonds With China’s Leader
summary: President Trump’s extraordinary summit with President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia last month has yet to yield any concrete results on the war in Ukraine.

title: In a ‘Hot Mic’ Moment, Xi and Putin Muse About Immortality and Organ Transplants
summary: Medical advances and geopolitics collide for two septuagenarian leaders who have suggested that their time in office is far from over.

title: Trump Advisers Have Discussed a Job for Adams if He Quits Mayor’s Race
summary: The conversations have also involved finding a place for Curtis Sliwa with the goal of giving Andrew Cuomo a better chance of defeating Zohran Mamdani in November.

title: The Communist Warrior Stranded for Decades in an ‘American Colony’
summary: Ahn Hak-sop was captured during the Korean War by the South and imprisoned for more than 40 years. Now 95, he wants to return to the North to die.

title: In Texas, a Senate Race Turns Brutal Before It’s Even Declared
summary: Attorney General Ken Paxton is waging “legal war” against Beto O’Rourke, a possible Democratic rival, threatening jail and an investigation that could bankrupt his organization.

title: Newsom and Republicans Scramble to Raise Cash in California Redistricting Fight
summary: Total spending could top $200 million in a November contest that could help determine control of the House next year.

title: White House Orders Agencies to Escalate Fight Against Offshore Wind
summary: The effort involves several agencies that typically have little to do with wind power, including the Health and Human Services Department.

title: Newsmax Accuses Fox News of Violating Antitrust Laws
summary: The smaller outlet in conservative TV news argued in a lawsuit that Fox News had essentially created a monopoly. Fox said the case had no merit.

title: Rats in a Stroller: The Central Park Playground Panic
summary: City data actually suggest that rat sightings are declining. But horror stories are everywhere, and a single rat in a stroller is enough to set off a panic.

title: Google Search Monopoly Ruling Sends Signal for Big-Tech Antitrust Cases
summary: A federal judge ordered steps in the search monopoly case that will restrain Google but not break it up, signaling a cautious antitrust approach by courts.

summary: America’s withdrawal from the global order is forcing former allies to rethink their identities.

title: Seattle Police Conclude 13 Years of Federal Oversight
summary: A federal judge ended the monitoring imposed after allegations of excessive force and racial bias. The city pointed to progress in improving officer accountability and training.

title: Lightning-Sparked Fires Force Evacuations and Destroy Buildings in California
summary: Fires sparked by lightning strikes that hit California early Tuesday razed over 13,000 acres in the foothills of the Sierra Nevada, officials said.

title: Patrick Hemingway, Ernest’s Devoted Second Son, Is Dead at 97
summary: Inspired by his parents’ travels, he spent much of his life in Africa and helped complete his father’s safari memoir. He also published a volume of father-son letters.
